description: Creates a channel. For information about MediaTailor channels, see Working with channels in the MediaTailor User Guide.

parameters.name: FillerSlate
parameters.description: The slate used to fill gaps between programs in the schedule. You must configure filler slate if your channel uses the LINEAR PlaybackMode. MediaTailor doesn't support filler slate for channels using the LOOP PlaybackMode. SourceLocationName (string) --- The name of the source location where the slate VOD source is stored. VodSourceName (string) --- The slate VOD source name. The VOD source must already exist in a source location before it can be used for slate.

nested_params.name: SourceLocationName
nested_params.description: The name of the source location where the slate VOD source is stored.

nested_params.name: VodSourceName
nested_params.description: The slate VOD source name. The VOD source must already exist in a source location before it can be used for slate.

parameters.name: Outputs
parameters.description: The channel's output properties. (dict) --- The output configuration for this channel. DashPlaylistSettings (dict) --- DASH manifest configuration parameters. ManifestWindowSeconds (integer) --- The total duration (in seconds) of each manifest. Minimum value: 30 seconds. Maximum value: 3600 seconds. MinBufferTimeSeconds (integer) --- Minimum amount of content (measured in seconds) that a player must keep available in the buffer. Minimum value: 2 seconds. Maximum value: 60 seconds. MinUpdatePeriodSeconds (integer) --- Minimum amount of time (in seconds) that the player should wait before requesting updates to the manifest. SuggestedPresentationDelaySeconds (integer) --- Amount of time (in seconds) that the player should be from the live point at the end of the manifest. HlsPlaylistSettings (dict) --- HLS playlist configuration parameters. AdMarkupType (list) --- Determines the type of SCTE 35 tags to use in ad markup. Specify DATERANGE to use DATERANGE tags (for live or VOD content). Specify SCTE35_ENHANCED to use EXT-X-CUE-OUT and EXT-X-CUE-IN tags (for VOD content only). (string) --- The name of the manifest for the channel. The name appears in the PlaybackUrl. A string used to match which HttpPackageConfiguration is used for each VodSource.

nested_params.name: ManifestWindowSeconds
nested_params.description: The total duration (in seconds) of each manifest. Minimum value: 30 seconds. Maximum value: 3600 seconds.

nested_params.name: MinBufferTimeSeconds
nested_params.description: Minimum amount of content (measured in seconds) that a player must keep available in the buffer. Minimum value: 2 seconds. Maximum value: 60 seconds.

nested_params.name: MinUpdatePeriodSeconds
nested_params.description: Minimum amount of time (in seconds) that the player should wait before requesting updates to the manifest. Minimum value: 2 seconds. Maximum value: 60 seconds.

nested_params.name: SuggestedPresentationDelaySeconds
nested_params.description: Amount of time (in seconds) that the player should be from the live point at the end of the manifest. Minimum value: 2 seconds. Maximum value: 60 seconds.

nested_params.name: ManifestWindowSeconds
nested_params.description: The total duration (in seconds) of each manifest. Minimum value: 30 seconds. Maximum value: 3600 seconds.

nested_params.name: AdMarkupType
nested_params.description: Determines the type of SCTE 35 tags to use in ad markup. Specify DATERANGE to use DATERANGE tags (for live or VOD content). Specify SCTE35_ENHANCED to use EXT-X-CUE-OUT and EXT-X-CUE-IN tags (for VOD content only).

nested_params.name: ManifestName
nested_params.description: The name of the manifest for the channel. The name appears in the PlaybackUrl.

nested_params.name: SourceGroup
nested_params.description: A string used to match which HttpPackageConfiguration is used for each VodSource.

parameters.name: PlaybackMode
parameters.description: The type of playback mode to use for this channel. LINEAR - The programs in the schedule play once back-to-back in the schedule. LOOP - The programs in the schedule play back-to-back in an endless loop. When the last program in the schedule stops playing, playback loops back to the first program in the schedule.

parameters.name: Tags
parameters.description: The tags to assign to the channel. Tags are key-value pairs that you can associate with Amazon resources to help with organization, access control, and cost tracking. For more information, see Tagging AWS Elemental MediaTailor Resources. (string) --- (string) ---

parameters.name: TimeShiftConfiguration
parameters.description: The time-shifted viewing configuration you want to associate to the channel. The maximum time delay for time-shifted viewing. The minimum allowed maximum time delay is 0 seconds, and the maximum allowed maximum time delay is 21600 seconds (6 hours).

nested_params.name: MaxTimeDelaySeconds
nested_params.description: The maximum time delay for time-shifted viewing. The minimum allowed maximum time delay is 0 seconds, and the maximum allowed maximum time delay is 21600 seconds (6 hours).

parameters.name: Audiences
parameters.description: The list of audiences defined in channel. (string) ---

nested_items.description: The name to assign to the channel.

nested_items.name: ChannelState
nested_items.description: Indicates whether the channel is in a running state or not.

nested_items.description: The timestamp of when the channel was created.

nested_items.description: The timestamp of when the channel was last modified.

nested_items.name: ManifestName
nested_items.description: The name of the manifest for the channel that will appear in the channel output's playback URL.

nested_items.name: PlaybackUrl
nested_items.description: The URL used for playback by content players.

nested_items.name: SourceGroup
nested_items.description: A string used to associate a package configuration source group with a channel output.

nested_items.description: The playback mode to assign to the channel.
